an9.51:4.1: “Reverend, they speak of ‘extinguishment in the present life’.
an9.51:4.2: In what way did the Buddha speak of extinguishment in the present life?”
an9.51:5.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures …
an9.51:5.2: enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.51:5.3: Thus far the Buddha spoke of extinguishment in the present life in a qualified sense. …
an9.51:6.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.51:6.2: Thus far the Buddha spoke of extinguishment in the present life in an unqualified sense.”
